Description: Papyrus written with blank ink with demotic legal document recording sale of land. 7 lines on recto (plus 4 signatures at foot) and names of 19 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Sale (and receipt) of land by Zeho (Teos) son of Pefteuchons to Anchsemteu son of Harnoufi. Date. year 17 [correct reading: 29] of an unnamed King - perhaps Amasis (B.C. 553-526)".
Curator's comments: Thompson MS: " Publ. Reich u.s. pg. pl.II-IV, cf Sethe, Burgschaftsurkunden, p b85 & eg."(?) Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Being studied by K. Donker van Heel (Leiden).
Bibliographic references: Reich 1914 / Papyri juistischen Inhalts in hieratischer und demotischer Schrift aus dem British Museum (p.9-25, pl.2-4)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (46066) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/46066)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss, skeletal Black ink Backed: brown paper Unsupported locally Tabbed displayed in Room 63 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair
